data.title: Nineties TV legend unrecognisable 20 years after starring in biggest teen show of the decade â€“ & has surprising new job
data.meta_description: NINETIES TV star Kerr Smith looks unrecognisable 20 years after starring in teen drama Dawson's Creek.The actor joined Dawson's Creek in season two, a
data.text:
NINETIES TV star Kerr Smith looks unrecognisable 20 years after starring in teen drama Dawson's Creek.

The actor joined Dawson's Creek in season two, and went on to be one of the leading characters.

He played Jack McPhee, the first openly-gay character to smooch on screen.

Kerr, now 51, often keeps fans updated on his life away from the camera, with snaps on ski holidays and enjoying cycling trips.

And he looks very different now, after swapping his brown locks for a silver fox look.

The actor has appeared in a number of hit US shows - Agents of SHIELD, Charmed, NCIS, and two CSI series - NY and Miami.

Since 2019, he has played Principal Holden Honey in hit teen drama Riverdale

But when he's not acting, Kerr also has a very different side hustle.

Kerr enjoys the perks of being a certified pilot and also started a holistic health and wellness business, TerraLife Wellness, with his second wife Lisa.

He was married to Harmoni Everett, tying the knot in 2003 before splitting in 2009.

He's not the only one that has changed and ventured onto new TV shows.

James Van Der Beek played floppy haired Dawson Leery, the title character.

Since departing the Creek, he has appeared in How I Met Your Mother, Ugly Betty, and Criminal Minds.

While Joshua Jackson played the cheeky Pacey Witter starred in Peter Bishop in Sky One's Fringe.

In 2020 he starred in Little Fires Everywhere and featured in Dr. Death.

Katie Holmes, Michelle Williams and Meredith Monroe also starred in Dawson's Creek.
